qas.question: What event did Nasser exploit to his advantage?
To what group did many of the arrested dissenters belong?
Who avoided a death sentence in favor of 15 years in jail?
Where did Naguib end up after the turmoil?
Who assumed total control of Egypt?

context: The crowd roared in approval and Arab audiences were electrified. The <a0_0>assassination attempt<a0_0/> backfired, quickly playing into Nasser's hands. Upon returning to Cairo, he ordered one of the largest political crackdowns in the modern history of Egypt, with the arrests of thousands of dissenters, mostly members of the <a1_0>Brotherhood<a1_0/>, but also communists, and the dismissal of 140 officers loyal to Naguib. Eight Brotherhood leaders were sentenced to death, although the sentence of its chief ideologue, <a2_0>Sayyid Qutb<a2_0/>, was commuted to a 15-year imprisonment. Naguib was removed from the presidency and put under <a3_0>house arrest<a3_0/>, but was never tried or sentenced, and no one in the army rose to defend him. With his rivals neutralized, <a4_0>Nasser<a4_0/> became the undisputed leader of Egypt.
